blog.title: THIS IS A DETECTIVE PIKACHU FANBLOG

I don't queue anything because I'm not a bottom.
He/Him

tags: let's tag it anyway so people see it
caption: I have no excuses.

blog.name: pious-smasher
blog.title: Egoistic Martyr
blog.description:
Erika Born in 1992
Homestuck, MtG, Warhammer, MLP, Warframe, Persona, Mass Effect, One Piece, Comics, other fandoms and Egalitarian ramblings 
Political shit tagged "Social Justice" , Recent Homestuck spoilers tagged "Upd8", and One Piece spoilers are tagged as  "OP spoilers" though I only tag them for recent manga chapters. Steven Universe spoilers tagged as "SU spoilers" and RWBY gets "rwby spoilers".Anything else gets just as "spoilers" I tag nsfw as such, though anything beyond a tasteful pinup gets tagged "explicit" as well.
 LIst of fandoms I will get involved in here
http://pious-smasher.tumblr.com/post/173803693568/list-of-fandoms-i-will-get-involved-in-the-drama
If you need something tagged just ask.

summary: Peter Parker can only wield Mjolnir when he has put aside his fear and embraced the role of a father, or is in a mindset which...
body: Peter Parker can only wield Mjolnir when he has put aside his fear and embraced the role of a father, or is in a mindset which he could work as a dad.

blog.name: thevideonastiest
blog.title: The Willem Dafoe and Other Appreciation Society
blog.description: Hi i'm Chloe! This blog is mostly for things like crushes and self-insert things, so come down and don't be shy! 😁It can get lewd here, so 18+!

title: A Friendly Face
body:
This is an older self-insert fic with Raimi-verse Norman Osborn I can’t find on my older blog. But here it’s back again :D It’s about the friendship first starting to grow <3 Enjoy!

The rich scent of chocolate filled Chloe’s senses for a moment as she pulled back the clingfilm over a tub of homemade brownies. The new secretary at Oscorp had only been there a month or so, but she was looking to make friends where she could and give the other employees in the building a treat, including her boss, Norman Osborn. His days seemed split between his office building where Chloe worked, or the labs about a half hour drive away, so Chloe saw him more infrequently than most secretaries would their boss. But from what she experienced, he seemed like a nice man, a little aloof under the car salesman attitude he projected sure, but that seemed expected of a businessman. He was never rude when calling her about a job and he always mouthed a quick “Thanks” as she set his coffee on the desk as he talked on the phone, before faking a laugh with whoever he was talking to at the time.

All seemed well, as she took out a nice big piece of the dessert and put it on a plate, complete with napkin and fork, grabbed the hot mug of expresso she sat on her desk, then headed in the direction of her boss’s office. She mused in her head that he’ll find it such a nice treat since she never saw Norman eat any sweets or … well, she didn’t see him eat often actually, mostly he was just drinking coffee. But then maybe he doesn’t like them or maybe he has really specific tastes, she soon started worrying. Still, Chloe didn’t have too much time to worry, she had just reached the door to his office. After a bit of juggling with the food in her hands, she tapped on the door and waited for a reply.

No answer. Waiting a few seconds before tapping again, there was still no reply back. Chloe raised her eyebrow, usually he was back in his office for lunchtime after his morning meeting with the board members, maybe it was going overtime? Still, the door was locked and the coffee was going to get cold if she stood around for too long, so she decided to head in the direction of the meeting room. On the way there, she recognised a few faces being members of the board, walking through the halls away from the direction of the typical meeting spot. ‘How odd.’ she thought, the meeting was over and looked to have finished at the same time as normal, but Norman was nowhere to be found among the faces. Asking around, she got told that the last Norman was seen he was still seated in the board room, so Chloe continued on her journey, walking as brisk as she could in her heels to avoid cold coffee on her hands, but slow enough still to avoid hot coffee on her hands.

Arriving outside the large brown doors to the board room, Chloe repeated her adjustments before tapping away and waiting. This time a tired but familiar “Yes?” was the reply, and so Chloe pushed down the handle and stepped in. On the other side of the room sat Norman, at his usual spot at the head of the table. This time however he didn’t look as commandeering in his position, on his own and surrounded by the empty cups of the board members while he slumped over the table slightly, his blue eyes looking downwards and his thin lips were a visible frown. Norman looked up expecting a cleaner to come in, but was surprised by the sight of his secretary instead.

Still, Norman just as quickly erased the surprise from his face and flashed a forced smile in her direction. “Ah, Miss Fraser!” he greeted in his distinct gravelly voice, “Sorry, I must have kept you waiting. My mind must have wandered.” His white crooked teeth gritted together shut in the smile Chloe saw him use around his business partners, but his eyes still looked sad. Chloe approached his end of the table, smiling gently and setting his drink down on his coaster, replacing his old mug. “That’s ok, sir! Thinking about much?” she asked, hoping he might share what looked to be troubling him. Norman took a polite sip of the drink and replied, shaking his head slightly, “Not really. Just reflecting on the meeting.” At that, he expected her to make her leave like his previous secretaries would, but Chloe asked on. “Oh, how did the meeting go?” she said, putting the plate down, still turned to him and smiling with her head leaning in to hear his answer. Norman’s own smile loosened as he looked her up and down, not sure why she was so curious to know. Still he replied with a vague, “Well, it was eventful. It’ll be a hot topic for the next lab visit by the board anyway”, before taking another sip. As eager as ever, Chloe once again asked “Oh, well what happened?”

At this last question, Norman sat his drink back down then looked back up to Chloe and a forced chuckle escaped his lips. “Miss Fraser,” he began, “You don’t have to ask me these questions just because you’re my employee, you know?” Chloe cocked her head in slight confusion over his dismissive reaction, before replying with a smile “I know, but I want to know if you’re ok.” Norman’s brow raised and Chloe swore she could see the faintest touch of pink on her boss’s sunken cheeks, before he quickly regained himself and responded, “That’s very sweet of you. But i’m fine. Besides, you must be busy right now.” Chloe let out a light giggle before explaining “It’s lunchtime, Mr Osborn. I finished mine before coming up, so i’m free for the next hour.”, she then sat herself down in the chair closest to Norman’s and placed the plate of brownie in front of him.

Norman’s eyes widened before looking to Chloe again, brow cocked. “Is this for me?” he asked, pink cheeks returning. Chloe blushed just as hard through her grin, nodding and replying sheepishly “I bake about once a month, so I thought i’d start bringing them in to share. And a nice treat after a long meeting sounds pretty good i’d say!” Norman had looked back down to the baked good in front of him, still taking in her words, but processing just how … nice this was! No one ever asked him how he was doing at work unless it was just basic politeness or to suck up to him. But all these questions and the brownie, it was more effort than anyone had ever put in. As Norman looked back up to Chloe’s kind smile, he found his mouth involuntarily twitching into a genuine smile back.

“Thank you.” was all he could muster up in his state of bewilderment, but she still smiled all the wider at his kind grin breaking through. “It’s no problem at all! Now, what happened at the meeting?” she asked again, arms folded in front of her on the table, ready for a story. Norman pursed his lips in thought, thinking it over a bit more on whether he should start talking about it proper still. Mid-thought, he took the fork into his hand and picked up a bit of brownie in it before eating. As soon as he started chewing, a sudden hum of pleasure left his lips as he took in the rich taste of dark chocolate. It was the best … well only brownie he had eaten in years. At that and with another look at Chloe, still beaming and blushing at his approval of her goods, his mind was made up.

“There’s a hell of a lot to take in, i’ll tell you Miss Fraser. But I can start at the beginning …”
body_abstract: This is an older self-insert fic with Raimi-verse Norman Osborn I can’t find on my older blog. But here it’s back again :D It’s about the friendship first starting to grow <3 Enjoy!

At this last question, Norman sat his drink back down then looked back up to Chloe and a forced chuckle escaped his lips. “Miss Fraser,” he began, “You don’t have to ask me these questions just because you’re my employee, you know?” Chloe cocked her head in slight confusion over his dismissive reaction, before replying with a smile “I know, but I want to know if you’re ok.” Norman’s brow raised and Chloe swore she could see the faintest touch of pink on her boss’s sunken cheeks, before he quickly regained himself and responded, “That’s very sweet of you. But i’m fine. Besides, you must be busy right now.” Chloe let out a light giggle before explaining “It’s lunchtime, Mr Osborn. I finished mine before coming up, so i’m free for the next hour.”, she then sat herself down in the chair closest to Norman’s and placed the plate of brownie in front of him.

Norman’s eyes widened before looking to Chloe again, brow cocked. “Is this for me?” he asked, pink cheeks returning. Chloe blushed just as hard through her grin, nodding and replying sheepishly “I bake about once a month, so I thought i’d start bringing them in to share. And a nice treat after a long meeting sounds pretty good i’d say!” Norman had looked back down to the baked good in front of him, still taking in her words, but processing just how … nice this was! No one ever asked him how he was doing at work unless it was just basic politeness or to suck up to him. But all these questions and the brownie, it was more effort than anyone had ever put in. As Norman looked back up to Chloe’s kind smile, he found his mouth involuntarily twitching into a genuine smile back.

“Thank you.” was all he could muster up in his state of bewilderment, but she still smiled all the wider at his kind grin breaking through. “It’s no problem at all! Now, what happened at the meeting?” she asked again, arms folded in front of her on the table, ready for a story. Norman pursed his lips in thought, thinking it over a bit more on whether he should start talking about it proper still. Mid-thought, he took the fork into his hand and picked up a bit of brownie in it before eating. As soon as he started chewing, a sudden hum of pleasure left his lips as he took in the rich taste of dark chocolate. It was the best … well only brownie he had eaten in years. At that and with another look at Chloe, still beaming and blushing at his approval of her goods, his mind was made up.

“There’s a hell of a lot to take in, i’ll tell you Miss Fraser. But I can start at the beginning …”
trail.content_abstract: This is an older self-insert fic with Raimi-verse Norman Osborn I can’t find on my older blog. But here it’s back again :D It’s about the friendship first starting to grow <3 Enjoy!

summary: headcanon that Ned runs a spider-man fan club in school where they discuss their mutual love for spider-man and also share...
body:
headcanon that Ned runs a spider-man fan club in school where they discuss their mutual love for spider-man and also share theories and stuff they’ve found out about him, partly because Ned loves his best friend and wants to support him but also partly to make sure that none of the spider-man fans in the school are getting onto peter being spider-man because his best friend is a dumbass who runs across washington d.c. wearing his quiz team blazer over his suit

and obviously Flash joins the club because he’s the Number One Spider-Man Stan and Ned eventually reluctantly makes him co-leader because a) he’s actually one of the most active members and shows up to every meeting with a bunch of new theories and evidence to back them up and b) his theories are all nowhere near the truth and Flash is the last person to ever suspect Peter of being spider-man.

and then Ned can’t make it one week and gets Peter to fill in as co-chair, which Flash is obviously not happy about and spends the entire meeting quizzing Peter on obsure spider-man trivia to try and prove he’s a Fake Fan. Peter is increasingly torn between not wanting to cast suspicion on himself by appearing to know too much, and watching Flash get increasingly frustrated as he tries to think of more and more difficult questions for him to answer. this only ends when MJ (who sits at the back of every meeting “observing”) comes forward with an extremely long and complicated theory about spider-man which posits the involvement of at least 23 government agencies and takes up the rest of the meeting, and by the end no-one has any more of an idea about who spider-man really is (which may or may not have been the intention)

summary:
He doesn't have enough confidence to actually be a model anyway.
Introducing his universes Spidey bff who knows his...
body:
He doesn’t have enough confidence to actually be a model anyway.

Introducing his universes Spidey bff who knows his identity/potential MJ? This is Jo, she’s 18, planning on being a photography major and interns at Octavias Labs. Owen kind of considers her family at this point and has a lot of trust in her. Though he did reveal his identity to her on accident via forgetting to put on his mask one time. They goof around a lot with each other and are just in general really good pals.
